alert.note: Alert for Acadia; Allen; Avoyelles; Beauregard; Calcasieu; East Cameron; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Rapides; St. Landry; West Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 2:34AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cameron, southeastern Rapides, Jefferson Davis, Evangeline, southeastern Beauregard, northwestern Acadia, Calcasieu, southwestern Avoyelles, northwestern St. Landry and Allen Parishes through 345 AM CST... At 233 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Reddell to near Kinder to near Carlyss to 9 miles southeast of Sabine Pass. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Sulphur, Eunice, Oakdale, Ville Platte, Cameron, Westlake, Bunkie, Mamou, Welsh, Iowa, Kinder, Basile, Oberlin, Elton, Cheneyville, Turkey Creek, Fenton, Reeves and Hayes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 14 and 60. Interstate 210 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 49 between mile markers 29 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central and southwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Acadia; Allen; Avoyelles; Beauregard; Calcasieu; East Cameron; Evangeline; Jefferson Davis; Rapides; St. Landry; West Cameron
